result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaqualan C Bond

records.addlTxt: Order to Quash Warrant filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 10/11/22 sp)
Motion to Quash Warrant filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 10/11/22 sp)

2:46 PM Defendant Jaqualan C Bond not in court.  Attorney (Atty) Taylor O Soule in court for Jaqualan C Bond.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Soule doesn't know where her client is today.
State requests a warrant.
Atty Soule request a cash alternative.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant - body only
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Soule.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/03/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
Not have any contact with Walmart stores.

01:00 PM Defendant Jaqualan Bond, and co-defendants Reginal Bond, Kiron Green, and Darious Young appeared by video.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler in court for State of WI. Attorney Taylor Soule  appears on behalf of the defendants.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Theft or Party to a Crime. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendants Reginal Bond, Jaqualan Bond, Kiron Green, and Darious Young are eligible for public defender representation at this time.

Reginald Bond: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated. 
Jaqualan Bond: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Darious Young: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Kiron Green: State requests a cash $500.00 bond with conditions as stated.
Attorney for the defendants objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 
Court sets signature bonds for the defendants.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
